keywords.value: Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (Parcc)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: A company is scrambling to purge the Internet of questions used in the exams, but some critics say public debate is the best way to make better tests.

headline.main: Leaked Questions Rekindle Debate Over Common Core Tests

snippet: A company is scrambling to purge the Internet of questions used in the exams, but some critics say public debate is the best way to make better tests.
abstract: Common Core reading and math tests for kindergarten through high school have come under strong criticism across United States, with many parents keeping their children from taking them; Prof Celia Oyler of Columbia University, who first took risk of posting fourth-grade reading questions online, has reignited angry national debate, although many critics of tests say posting has facilitated open public discussion of tests' contents; PARCC Inc, which has copyrights to test contents, has threatened to sue Oyler.
